result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Alan Parker

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Christopher Alan Parker in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Christopher Alan Parker.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF263, 22CT98, 22CT106. Attorney Nelsen notes that an offer was made, might be making a counter offer. Asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:36 AM Defendant Christopher Alan Parker in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Christopher Alan Parker.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF263, 22CT98, and 22CT106. In 22CF263, Attorney Nelsen acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. Attorney Nelsen asks that the cases be set for status to allow time to review discovery and the offer that has been extended by the State.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Calling cases 22CF263 and 22CT98
Defendant Christopher Alan Parker appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney Angela Wilson. 
Court confirms address; defendant indicates homeless. 709 E 5th Street, Superior WI 54880 mailing address
Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Attorney Hoffman makes a special appearance.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading for both cases. Not guilty plea(s) entered on misd counts. 
State requesting 22CT98 350cb, 22CF263 400cb, several non appearances; didn't show up voluntarily.  Warrants weren't entered because the court called the defendant and he answered the phone.  Did no report to jail for his conditional jail; there are more charges pending that aren't filed yet.
Attorney Hoffman-lifelong resident of douglas county, family ties, non student/unemployed.  no ability to post.  might be able to call family/friends
Court orders 350cb on 22ct98 with conditions of No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. 
1000cb on 22cf263 no special conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2033 at 10:30 am.
